This guide does not take into consideration unlockable content, such as fairy rings or dragon equipment that provides numerous benefits which assists the player's game progression. The optimal quest guide lists Old School RuneScape quests in an order that allows new level 3 members account to progress in an order that minimises the amount of skill training. This guide does not take into consideration unlockable content, such as fairy rings or dragon equipment that provides numerous benefits which assists the player's game progression. It is highly recommended that players complete the quests in the Recommended Quests section as soon as possible.

This guide is intended for iron accounts. For the regular guide, see here.

Contents

  • 1 Guide
    • 1.1 Notable quest unlocks
    • 1.2 Highest Skill Requirements' Quests
    • 1.3 Quests

Guide[edit | edit source]

Any experience lamps or book of knowledge received through random events or Achievement Diaries can be used on any skill of the player's choosing, either to shorten the next bit of training in the guide or to save time later on. If a player is planning to train Herblore, Runecraft, or Construction past those requirements necessary to complete all quests, they should consider prioritizing the use of lamps or optional quest rewards toward those skills.

Somewhat experienced players ought to use their Player-owned house to teleport across Gielinor to finish various quests. At level 50 Construction you can use portal chambers, mounted glories and Oak altars. But the more useful unlocks, such as additional teleportation options and stat-restoring features, require substantially higher Construction levels and are therefore rather expensive. To get there you want to use the Teleport to house tablets, which can also be used as emergency teleports.

New players on a budget should use games necklace(8) to teleport around or for access to a bank. You should also look at finishing some diaries to get your hands on some unlimited teleports which will be of great use throughout the game. Notable examples include the Ardougne Cloak 1 which gives you unlimited teleport close to an altar to restore your prayer, and from where you can run east to a fairy ring or west to a spirit tree. It also gives access to the Ardougne area early in the game, which is very useful. The Ectophial is useful for emergency teleports and for getting to the Morytania area.

Notable quest unlocks[edit source]

The quests below list some of the more notable unlockable content, teleportation methods, equipment, and locations. The quests below are not listed in any specific order.

  • Skill unlocks:
    • Druidic Ritual – Unlocks Herblore
    • Rune Mysteries – Unlocks the ability to use Lamps and Books of knowledge on Runecraft
    • Tears of Guthix – Unlocks weekly access to a minigame that rewards experience in the player's lowest skill, which is useful in aiding progress towards skilling goals.
    • Desert Treasure – Unlocks the ability to use Ancient Magicks
    • Lunar Diplomacy – Unlocks the ability to use Lunar spells
  • Transportation unlocks:
    • Plague City – Unlocks Ardougne teleport (Tablet teleport and spellbook teleport)
    • Enlightened Journey – Unlocks the Balloon Transport System
    • Fairytales Part 1 and start Part 2 – Access to fairy rings
    • Tree Gnome Village – Unlock spirit tree teleports
    • The Grand Tree – Unlocks gnome glider transportation
    • Ghosts Ahoy – Unlocks Ectophial and free passage to Port Phasmatys
    • Watchtower – Unlocks Watchtower Teleport(Tablet teleport and spellbook teleport)
    • Another Slice of H.A.M. – Unlocks the Dorgesh-Kaan–Keldagrim train system
    • A Taste of Hope - Unlocks Drakan's medallion
    • Eadgar's Ruse - Unlocks Trollheim Teleport
    • Shilo Village - Unlocks Shilo Village cart system
    • Eagle's Peak – Unlocks the Eagle transport system
  • Equipment unlocks:
    • The Great Brain Robbery – Unlocks the Barrelchest Anchor
    • Dwarf Cannon – Unlocks the Dwarf Multicannon
    • Dragon Slayer I – Ability to use green d'hide body, rune platebody and dragon platebody
    • Dragon Slayer II – Ability to create Ava's assembler
    • Family Crest – Unlocks Steel gauntlets
    • Animal Magnetism – Unlocks Ava's device
    • Recruitment Drive – Unlocks initiate armour
    • The Slug Menace – Unlocks proselyte armour
    • Recipe for Disaster – Completion of the subquests unlocks better Culinaromancer's gloves
    • Lost City – Ability to use the dragon dagger and the dragon longsword
    • Monkey Madness I – Ability to use dragon scimitar
    • Monkey Madness II - Ability to use the Heavy Ballista
    • The Fremennik Isles – Unlocks helm of neitiznot
    • The Fremennik Exiles – Unlocks Neitiznot Faceguard
    • Rum Deal – Unlocks Holy wrench
    • Haunted Mine – Unlocks Salve Amulet
  • Area unlocks
    • Priest In Peril – Unlocks Morytania
    • Bone Voyage – Unlocks Fossil Island
    • Throne of Miscellania – Unlocks Managing Miscellania
    • Regicide – Unlocks Tirannwn
    • Mourning's End Part I – Unlocks Lletya
    • Song of the Elves – Unlocks Prifddinas
    • Making Friends with My Arm – Unlocks Weiss
    • Sins of the Father – Unlocks Darkmeyer
    • Below Ice Mountain – Unlocks Ruins of Camdozaal

Quests[edit | edit source]

This list does not include suggestions for combat levels. Boss fights might be nearly impossible to do with the stats listed here. Always make sure to train up your combat stats to a level at which you're confident you can kill or survive dangerous parts of the listed quests.

If the additional info mentions: "Buy 3 of silk" for example, do not hesitate to use the silk in a certain quest afterwards, that's why it was mentioned. Not every mention of the need to buy something has a direct mention of why to do this. So do not hesitate to use the items you have gathered. Make sure to stock enough common items, like ropes, buckets, pots, etcetera. If you encounter other useful Tools like Moulds, Axes and Fishing equipment make sure to bank those as well. Have a look at Tools page for a useful list.

Hover over a skill reward in the "New levels after finishing quest" column to see the exact total experience in the listed skill after completing the quest.

{{External|rs=Quests/Strategy}} {{Incomplete|mostly copied from the main article, missing [[Land of the Goblins]]}} The '''optimal quest guide''' lists ''[[Old School RuneScape]]'' [[quests]] in an order that allows new level 3 [[members]] account to progress in an order that minimises the amount of [[skill]] training. This guide does not take into consideration [[unlockable content]], such as [[fairy rings]] or [[dragon equipment]] that provides numerous benefits which assists the player's game progression. It is highly recommended that players complete the quests in the [[Optimal quest guide#Recommended Quests|Recommended Quests]] section as soon as possible. This guide is intended for [[Ironman Mode|iron accounts]]. For the regular guide, see [[Optimal quest guide|here]]. ==Guide== Any [[experience lamp]]s or [[book of knowledge]] received through [[random events]] or [[Achievement Diary|Achievement Diaries]] can be used on any skill of the player's choosing, either to shorten the next bit of training in the guide or to save time later on. If a player is planning to train Herblore, Runecraft, or Construction past those requirements necessary to complete all quests, they should consider prioritizing the use of lamps or optional quest rewards toward those skills. Somewhat experienced players ought to use their [[Player-owned house]] to teleport across [[Gielinor]] to finish various quests. At level 50 Construction you can use [[portal chamber]]s, [[mounted glory|mounted glories]] and [[Oak altar]]s. But the more useful unlocks, such as additional teleportation options and stat-restoring features, require substantially higher Construction levels and are therefore rather expensive. To get there you want to use the [[Teleport to house]] tablets, which can also be used as emergency teleports. New players on a budget should use [[games necklace(8)]] to teleport around or for access to a bank. You should also look at finishing some diaries to get your hands on some unlimited teleports which will be of great use throughout the game. Notable examples include the [[Ardougne Cloak 1]] which gives you unlimited teleport close to an altar to restore your prayer, and from where you can run east to a [[fairy ring]] or west to a [[spirit tree]]. It also gives access to the Ardougne area early in the game, which is very useful. The [[Ectophial]] is useful for emergency teleports and for getting to the Morytania area. {{Optimal quest guide/Recommended Quests}} ===Highest Skill Requirements' Quests=== The quests requiring the highest skill levels, along with the levels required (some without boosts) are: {| class="wikitable sortable lighttable" |- !Skill !Level !Quest |- |{{SCP|Agility}} [[Agility]] |70 |[[Song of the Elves]] |- |{{SCP|Attack}} [[Attack]] |50 |[[Sins of the Father]] |- |{{SCP|Construction}} [[Construction]] |70 |[[Song of the Elves]] |- |{{SCP|Cooking}} [[Cooking]] |70 |[[Recipe for Disaster]] (Freeing King Awowogei) |- |{{SCP|Crafting}} [[Crafting]] |70 |[[Monkey Madness II]] |- |{{SCP|Defence}} [[Defence]] |65 |[[King's Ransom]] |- |{{SCP|Farming}} [[Farming]] |70 |[[Song of the Elves]] |- |{{SCP|Firemaking}} [[Firemaking]] |66 |[[Making Friends with My Arm]] |- |{{SCP|Fishing}} [[Fishing]] |62 |[[Swan Song]] |- |{{SCP|Fletching}} [[Fletching]] |60 |[[Sins of the Father]] |- |{{SCP|Herblore}} [[Herblore]] |70 |[[Song of the Elves]] |- |{{SCP|Hitpoints}} [[Hitpoints]] |50 |[[Dragon Slayer II]] |- |{{SCP|Hunter}} [[Hunter]] |70 |[[Song of the Elves]] |- |{{SCP|Magic}} [[Magic]] |75 |[[Dragon Slayer II]] |- |{{SCP|Mining}} [[Mining]] |72 |[[Making Friends with My Arm]] |- |{{SCP|Prayer}} [[Prayer]] |50 |[[The Great Brain Robbery]] |- |{{SCP|Ranged}} [[Ranged]] |60 |[[Mourning's End Part I]] |- |{{SCP|Runecraft}} [[Runecraft]] |55 |[[The Fremennik Exiles]] |- |{{SCP|Slayer}} [[Slayer]] |69 |[[Monkey Madness II]] |- |{{SCP|Smithing}} [[Smithing]] |70 |[[Dragon Slayer II]]/[[Song of the Elves]] |- |{{SCP|Strength}} [[Strength]] |50 |[[Legends' Quest]] |- |{{SCP|Thieving}} [[Thieving]] |60 |[[Dragon Slayer II]] |- |{{SCP|Woodcutting}} [[Woodcutting]] |71 |[[Grim Tales]] |- |{{SCP|Combat}} [[Combat level]] |85 |[[Dream Mentor]] |- |{{SCP|Quests}} [[Quests]] |200 |[[Dragon Slayer II]] |} ===Quests=== {{#vardefine:colspan|8}}{{#vardefine:questpoints|0}}{{#vardefine:attackxp|0}}{{#vardefine:agilityxp|0}}{{#vardefine:constructionxp|0}}{{#vardefine:cookingxp|0}}{{#vardefine:craftingxp|0}}{{#vardefine:defencexp|0}}{{#vardefine:farmingxp|0}}{{#vardefine:firemakingxp|0}}{{#vardefine:fishingxp|0}}{{#vardefine:fletchingxp|0}}{{#vardefine:herblorexp|0}}{{#vardefine:hitpointsxp|0}}{{#vardefine:hunterxp|0}}{{#vardefine:magicxp|0}}{{#vardefine:miningxp|0}}{{#vardefine:prayerxp|0}}{{#vardefine:rangedxp|0}}{{#vardefine:runecraftxp|0}}{{#vardefine:slayerxp|0}}{{#vardefine:smithingxp|0}}{{#vardefine:strengthxp|0}}{{#vardefine:thievingxp|0}}{{#vardefine:woodcuttingxp|0}} This list does not include suggestions for combat levels. [[Quest boss|Boss]] fights might be nearly impossible to do with the stats listed here. Always make sure to train up your combat stats to a level at which you're confident you can kill or survive dangerous parts of the listed quests. If the additional info mentions: "Buy 3 of silk" for example, do not hesitate to use the silk in a certain quest afterwards, that's why it was mentioned. Not every mention of the need to buy something has a direct mention of why to do this. So do not hesitate to use the items you have gathered. Make sure to stock enough common items, like ropes, buckets, pots, etcetera. If you encounter other useful [[Tool]]s like [[Mould]]s, [[Axe]]s and [[Fishing equipment]] make sure to bank those as well. Have a look at [[Tools]] page for a useful list. Hover over a skill reward in the "New levels after finishing quest" column to see the exact total experience in the listed skill after completing the quest. {| class="wikitable lighttable sticky-header align-center-2" |+Old School RuneScape Quest Guide !Quest/Action !QG !New levels after quest !Quest points !Total QP !Additional info !Location |- |[[Tutorial Island]] |''N/A'' |{{Optimal quest|hitpoints=1154}} |{{Optimal quest/qp|0}} |'''Optional''': When you arrive in Lumbridge, chop trees in Lumbridge until 12 Woodcutting to access the [[Canoe|canoe transport system]] (fletch the logs into arrow shafts or burn them). |[[Lumbridge]] |- |[[Cook's Assistant]] |[[Cook's Assistant/Quick guide|QG]] |{{Optimal quest|cooking=300}} |{{Optimal quest/qp|1}} |Bring an empty pot and bucket from Tutorial Island and coins to buy a spade. Gather the egg, flour, and milk on the west side of the [[River Lum]]. '''Optional''' take 2gp for a bucket from the general store; the extra milk will be used in [[Gertrude's Cat]]. * When gathering the grain, fill your inventory with grain and grind it all at the windmill. You can leave the flour in the bin to be picked up later, and this will save time in the future. * Kill [[chicken]] when grabbing the egg, pick up [[feather]]s for [[Client of Kourend]] and the [[raw chicken]] for [[Druidic Ritual]]. '''Note''': for [[Ironman Mode|Hardcore Ironmen]], it is highly recommended to kill chickens here until 15 Hitpoints for the [[Waterfall Quest]]. * Start [[Sheep Shearer]] while gathering the ingredients (you can fit 20 [[wool]] in the inventory) * Kill a cow in the cow pen and take the meat (for [[Druidic Ritual]]) * Start [[X Marks the Spot]] on the way back to Lumbridge Castle (pick up a [[spade]] at the Lumbridge General Store if necessary) |[[Lumbridge]] |- |[[Sheep Shearer]] |[[Sheep Shearer/Quick guide|QG]] |{{Optimal quest|crafting=200}} |{{Optimal quest/qp|1}} |Spin the wool after turning in the ingredients for [[Cook's Assistant]]. While in Lumbridge Castle, speak to Duke Horacio to start [[Rune Mysteries]]. Before turning in the wool: * Dig by Bob's Axe Shop for [[X Marks the Spot]] * Start [[The Restless Ghost]] in the chapel |[[Lumbridge]] |- |[[Misthalin Mystery]] |[[Misthalin Mystery/Quick guide|QG]] |{{Optimal quest|crafting=600}} |{{Optimal quest/qp|1}} |On the way from [[Lumbridge Castle]] to [[Lumbridge Swamp]]: * Dig for [[X Marks the Spot]] behind [[Lumbridge Castle]] on the way. * Kill 2 [[giant rat]]s behind [[Lumbridge Castle]] and take the [[raw rat meat]]'s (for [[Witch's Potion]] and [[Druidic Ritual]]). |[[Lumbridge]] |- | data-sort-value="Restless Ghost, The" |[[The Restless Ghost]] |[[The Restless Ghost/Quick guide|QG]] |{{Optimal quest|prayer=1125}} |{{Optimal quest/qp|1}} |Go to [[Father Urhney]] in [[Lumbridge Swamp]] after completing [[Misthalin Mystery]]. Be sure to then speak to the ghost to be able to grab the skull. Run from skeletons when gathering the skull. Finish [[X Marks the Spot]] and [[Witch's Potion]] before returning to Lumbridge to finish the quest. |[[Lumbridge]] |- |[[X Marks the Spot]] |[[X Marks the Spot/Quick guide|QG]] |{{Optimal quest|agility=300}} |{{Optimal quest/qp|1}} |During the quest, take a detour to the [[Wizards' Tower]] and speak to [[Wizard Sedridor]] for [[Rune Mysteries]]. While at the [[Wizards' Tower]], grab the skull for [[The Restless Ghost]], and start [[Imp Catcher]] by speaking to [[Wizard Mizgog]]. While in Draynor Village, start [[Vampyre Slayer]] and buy 5 or 10 [[jugs of wine]] from [[Fortunato]] as early food.
